item.title: Rural Villa at Neerhaaren-Rekem
item.description: Province Germania inferior Location Neerhaaren-Rekem Neerhaaren-Rekem (Pleiades) Location Description Sublocation Sublocation Description Garden Rural villa at Neerhaaren-Rekem Keywords rural villas villae rusticae arbors pergolas piscinae Garden Description The facade of this modest house of a villa rustica near the Meuse river measured 24 m. in length and had two protruding wings joined by a portico (Plan 1). The house was built in the late 1st century A.D. There is evidence for an arbor or pergola next to the house in the form of two rows of postholes arranged diagonally and converging in front of the entrance on the west (circles on plan).

item.title: The Houses of Insula 7 in Colonia Ulpia Traiana
item.description: Province Germania inferior Location Xanten Xanten (Pleiades) Location Description Sublocation Industrial quarter Sublocation Description This insula southeast of the forum is commonly referred to as an industrial quarter (Plan 1). It was divided into several long, narrow plots on which were houses, shops and workshops. Garden The houses of Insula 7 in Colonia Ulpia Traiana (Xanten) Keywords insulae kitchen gardens courtyards Garden Description Between the buildings were open areas, some paved and equipped with ovens and pottery kilns, wells and latrines, others unpaved.

item.title: Urban House on Lungenstrasse
item.description: Province Germania inferior Location Cologne Cologne (Pleiades) Location Description This large town on the west bank of the Rhine river was the civitas capital of the Ubii in the first half of the 1st century A.D. It was granted the status of colonia by Claudius in 50 and became the provincial capital in 85. Sublocation Sublocation Description Garden Urban house on Lungenstrasse (Colonia Claudia Ara Agrippinensium) Keywords peristyles (Roman courtyards)

item.title: Rustic villa at Blankenheim-H端lchrath
item.description: Province Germania inferior Location Blankenheim-H端lchrath Blankenheim-H端lchrath (Pleiades) Location Description Sublocation Sublocation Description Garden Rustic villa at Blankenheim-H端lchrath Keywords rural villas villae rusticae Garden Description This villa rustica was built on a slope so that the residential building (A on Plan 1) overlooked the rest of the lower lying farmyard (Image 1). The entire complex covered an area 120 m. in width and 250 m. in length (3 hectares). The house was separated from a large open area behind and to the southwest of it by a wall.
